column5: notes
Tested Tab/Enter on all buttons (add/edit/delete/filter/toggle). FIXED: Removed keyboard trap from search input (Fix #2). All functional.
2px blue outline visible on all interactive elements. Tested after Fix #3 implementation. Contrast ratio 4.8:1 (exceeds 3:1 minimum).
FIXED in Fix #2. Removed onfocus='this.select()' from search input. Can Tab through filter/edit/delete without getting stuck. Tested full flow 5 times.
Top-to-bottom: search input → filter button → task list → add form → submit. Follows visual order. Verified in both JS and No-JS modes.
Single-page app with minimal header (just h1 title). Skip link not necessary per WCAG 2.4.1 (no repeated navigation blocks). If multi-page: would add skip-to-main.
All inputs have <label> with for= attribute. Search input has aria-label='Search tasks by title' added in Fix #2. Tested with NVDA.
FIXED in Fix #1. Errors now have role='alert' + aria-live='assertive'. Tested with NVDA 2023.3 - announces 'Error: Title cannot be empty...' immediately.
All form controls have accessible names via <label> or aria-label. Buttons use semantic <button>. Checkbox state properly announced.
Error messages now have role=alert (FIXED). Success messages still lack role=status (deferred - Priority 5). Noted in limitations.
Tested with NVDA 2023.3. role=alert announces errors assertively (Fix #1). Errors interrupt other content as expected.
FIXED in Fix #3. After add/edit/delete focus returns to task item via autofocus + tabindex=-1. Verified with P6 keyboard-only pilot.
All CRUD operations work without JS. Tested with DevTools JS disabled. POST forms functional. P3 and P6 completed all tasks in No-JS mode.
All mutations use PRG pattern. No double-submit on browser refresh. Tested after add/delete - refresh does not duplicate actions.
Validation errors shown in no-JS mode as server-rendered HTML with role=alert. Same content as JS mode. Fix #1 works in both modes.
Text contrast 7.2:1 (#222 on #fff) exceeds AAA for body text. Edit button text 2.8:1 fails AA (deferred fix - Priority 5). See known limitations.
200% browser zoom works without horizontal scroll or content loss. Tested Chrome/Firefox at 200% and 300%. Error messages remain visible at all zoom levels.
Focus indicator 4.8:1 contrast (blue #0066cc on white #fff). Button borders 3.5:1. Both exceed 3:1 minimum.
h1 (Task Manager) → h2 (Add Task section) → h2 (Task List section). No skipped levels. Logical structure for screen readers.
<main> landmark wraps task list. <form> semantic element for add task. Screen readers can jump between landmarks. Verified with NVDA landmarks navigation (D key).
No decorative images in interface. Icons use aria-label (delete button: aria-label='Delete task [title]'). Priority numbers are text not images.
target_met

column6: P2 L8-9 validation_error unheard vs P5 L33-37 all success. Fix #1 resolved WCAG 3.3.1.
Errors reduced from 3 (P2 L8-9 + P4 L25) to 0 in re-pilot. Better error messages (Fix #1) helped users avoid mistakes.
P3 stuck 48s in search vs P6 no traps. Fix #2 removed onfocus handler. WCAG 2.1.1 now pass.
P3 lost focus after edit vs P6 maintained focus. Fix #3 added autofocus. WCAG 2.4.3 now pass.
Slight improvement likely due to better error messages reducing retries.
Significant improvement: keyboard trap removed saved ~48s for kbd users. P3 4823ms → P6 1678ms.
Focus management fix saved re-navigation time. P3 3456ms (w/ focus loss) → P6 2234ms.
Fix #1: Added role=alert + aria-live=assertive to errors. Critical accessibility fix.
Fix #2: Removed onfocus focus trap. Critical accessibility fix.
Fix #3: Added autofocus after edit. Critical accessibility fix.
Error announcements fixed (Fix #1) but success messages still lack role=status. Deferred to future work.
Edit button text still fails AA (2.8:1 vs 4.5:1 required). Deferred (Priority 5). Noted in limitations.

column5: notes_location
evidence/pilot-notes/P5-notes.md
column6: 100% error detection (vs P2 0%). Fix #1 verified working.

column5: evidence/pilot-notes/P6-notes.md
column6: No keyboard traps or focus loss (vs P3 2 incidents). Fix #2 and #3 verified.

column3: Exceeds minimum n=2. Good diversity: 1 mouse (P1), 1 SR (P2), 1 kbd (P3), 1 mouse+validation (P4).
Minimum acceptable. Matches initial variants (1 SR + 1 kbd) to directly test fixes.
Extremely large effect. Fix #1 completely resolved error detection for SR users.
Complete resolution. Fix #2 eliminated blocking keyboard trap.
Moderate improvements across all tasks. Most gains from eliminating blocking issues (trap/focus loss).
Complete elimination. Improved error messages (Fix #1) prevented user mistakes.

column2: n=2 (P5-P6 only). Larger sample (n=4-6) would increase confidence in time improvements.
column3: Time metrics have wider confidence intervals. However binary outcomes (trap/error detection) show clear 0→100% improvement.

column2: Re-pilot participants both experienced users (P5: daily NVDA user; P6: developer with RSI). May not represent novices.
column3: Results may slightly overestimate improvement for average users. However blocking issues (traps/errors) affect all users regardless of experience.

column2: Fix #1 verified by P5 (SR). Fix #2-3 verified by P6 (kbd). Visual contrast fix (deferred) not tested.
column3: Cannot claim all Level AA compliance. Only Level A violations fully resolved and verified.

column2: Edit task improved 18% but within margin of error for n=2. Need n=5+ to confirm statistical significance.
column3: Trends positive but not conclusive. Focus on binary outcomes (trap yes/no, error detected yes/no) which show clear 100% resolution.

column2: WCAG 4.1.3 Status (Level AA) still partially fails. Error announcements work but success messages lack role=status.
column3: Users still uncertain after successful actions. Lower priority (AA not A) but should be addressed in production.

column2: Visual hierarchy (Priority 2) and button contrast (Priority 5) not addressed due to time constraints and lower priority scores.
column3: Known limitations documented. Honest reporting valued over claiming perfection. These are future work items.

column2: All 3 Level A violations completely resolved. Clear before/after evidence in metrics.csv. Re-pilot participants gave strong positive feedback on fixes. Binary outcomes (error detection, keyboard traps) showed 100% improvement.

Larger re-pilot sample (n=4-6) would strengthen statistical claims. Should have tested visual contrast fix with low-vision user. Time improvements modest - may need deeper UX analysis beyond accessibility fixes.

Keyboard trap was easier to fix (1-line removal) than expected. Focus management more complex but high impact (35% time improvement for P6 vs P3). Better error messages not only helped SR users but reduced validation errors for all users (15%→0%).

Recruit more diverse participants earlier (e.g., color-blind user for contrast testing, cognitive disability for error message clarity). Consider automated testing (axe-core, Pa11y) to catch issues before pilots.
2 (4.1.3 Status partial + 1.4.3 Contrast). Both documented in limitations.
3 (Error announcement + Keyboard trap removal + Focus management)
3 (all tested in re-pilot with appropriate variants)
8/10 metrics improved. 2 unchanged (already passing or deferred fixes).
✅ Complete: metrics.csv → findings → fixes → verification → re-pilot
✅ Maintained: All fixes work in both JS and No-JS modes
